reviews.review_text:
Best Goan Seafood.
I had the best kingfish dish ever made. The wait is long as its the mother/daughter cooking & serving. But all the wait is 100% worth.
Very homely food. They also serve beer n drinks.

A quaint little family run restaurant close to Anjuna beach. Tucked away from the crowded eateries, this restaurant serves authentic Goan thali and other coastal dishes. Tried their King fish thali, with salads, kokum soup and the juiciest crab gravy Iâ€™ve ever tasted. If you want to enjoy a quiet authentic fish meal, you know where to go

A humble family run household eatery serving some really freshly prepared and delicious home food. The hosts were really warm and hospitable, our bad luck that we couldn't try out their fish thalis as their freshly catched supply was done for the day.

But still we could try out their prawn curry, prawns masala and pomfret fry. The prawns curry and rice was to die for and the pomfret fry was the star of the table. The fish was pretty decent sized and it was truly value for money. I will recommend this place to people who don't like fancy food and want to try the humble yet delicious home cooked fresh seafood. Will surely visit this place again for their thalis and prawns rawa fry.
